Ok, so I'll write up a mini guide:

If you have a PSP version that is 3.10 (not OE-A) Then you cannot play these games...yet.

If you have a PSP 3.03 (Again, not OE) or lower, see the above website for details ^^

If you have 3.10 OE-A, put the ISOs (after extraction) into G:\ISO (Where G is the letter that your PSP gets when you go into USB mode )

Thanks for the great Torrent ^^

I did it like this:
Start the PSP in Settinsmode (holding right button while starting it. Then choose "CPU Speed" and lower "UMD/ISO" speed down to 266.

I downloaded Daxter from this compilation which is only 430MB, while playing I noticed the cut scenes between levels was the opening intro scene...which didnt seem right, after some searching I found another copy of Daxter which proved my suspicions.

Daxter should be 1.30 GB (1,405,845,504 bytes) not 430MB.  Content has been ripped out the one included in this Compilation.

Ripping content out of game is something people used to do back in the MODEM Dial-Up days.. were in the 21st century with Broadband connections no need to release games with content missing.

Now it makes me wonder how many other titles in this compilation have contents ripped out of them.

For the few people who have issues... The customer firmwares have an option to allow you to boot ISO files using the M33 Driver. Just push the select key when you are in the main menu and a little menu pops up... Or if that is too confusing and you have put the ISO/CSO files into an ISO folder on the root of your memory stick then just stick ANY UMD in your drive... This works fine for anyone running custom firmware. I have these games running on a PSP slim with System Software 3.71 M33-3 which absolutely rocks...

Oh and to the idiots who keep complaining about the need for a Pandora Battery and jigstick if you don't want to use that go ahead and visit your local gaming shop and buy the f@#king games... Whiner babiers... You have to use a PB+JS for a total of 1 minute so borrow one from a friend if you don't know where to buy one. :P

alright kids, after a ton of reading I think I found a solution to the "the archive is either in unknown format or damaged" error.  Try installing a different torrent client, and re-open this torrent file. then close the program and copy the old "corrupted" files into the new folder.  What I found is the so called completed files were actually not done, they were reporting wrong.  I was using Azureus and I switched to BitTorrent.  Worked for me.  Hopefully this works for you guys!!
